metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0459 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 7u51 and 8, and Java SE Embedded 7u51, allows remote attackers to affect availability via unknown vectors related to 2D.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0459` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblcms2-2 - 2.6-3ubuntu2
liblcms2-utils - 2.6-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> in lucid+, NetX and the plugin moved to the icedtea-web package jdstrand> sun-java6 is not redistributable, no longer in the archive and no longer tracked sun-java5 is EOL upstream and no longer tracked mdeslaur> See lcms2 regression in bug #30

criterions.comment: lcms2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6-3ubuntu2').
